column1: Name: 1-Port Gigabit XPON Terminal with VoIP
"Interface": "1× PON Port\n1× 10/100/1000 Mbps RJ45 Port\n1× Phone Port"

"Advanced Features": "Upstream and Downstream FEC
Dynamic Bandwidth Allocation(DBA) support NSR/SR
Up to 16 T-CONTs and 256 GEM Ports
Optical power detection
Dying Gasp
Terminal Silent mechanism"

column2: VLAN transparent mode/VLAN translation mode/VLAN trunk mode
column3: Authentication based on SN and Password

column1: "Package Contents": "XPON Terminal XZ000-G6v\nPower Adapter\nQuick Installation Guide"

"Environment": "Operating Temperature: 0℃–40℃ (32℉–104℉)
Storage Temperature: -40℃–60℃ (-40℉–140℉)
Operating Humidity: 10%–90% non-condensing
Storage Humidity: 5%–90% non-condensing"

column8: or other Java-enabled browser\nSubscription with an internet service provider (for internet access)"

column1: Highlights: Gigabit Internet Access: One PON port and one gigabit LAN port provide fast transfer speeds.*
XPON Support: EPON + GPON dual mode offers greater flexibility for fiber internet access.
VoIP Calls: Supports multiple VoIP accounts and various call features to surpass traditional landlines.
Ease of Use: Quick and hassle-free installation with intelligent power-saving.
Remote Management: Supports the OMCI (ONU Management Control Interface) and TR-069 protocols for centralized configuration and management.
Content Notes: *Actual network speed may be limited by the rate of the product's Ethernet WAN or LAN port
column2: the rate supported by the network cable
